word: Sister E's husband then arose, testified that he would be a Christian. He is an influential man--a lawyer. His daughter was upon the anxious seat. [ANXIOUS SEAT: AT A REVIVAL MEETING, A SEAT, USUALLY NEAR THE PULPIT, OCCUPIED BY PERSONS CONCERNED ABOUT THEIR SPIRITUAL CONDITION.] Brother D then added his entreaties to ours. Sister D's also to their children. We entreated and at last prevailed. All came forward. The fathers and all the sons and other fathers followed their example. It was a day of gladness. Sister E said it was the happiest day of her life (diary, Feb. 19, 1868).--1SM 144, 145.
